intro: Malesherbia incana, commonly known as the woolly malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its silver-green, hairy foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its unique appearance and adaptability contribute to its appeal in both ornamental and ecological contexts.
